name: .PRC File Extension
summary: Learn about .PRC files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: A PRC file is a 3D model saved in the Product Representation Compact (PRC) format. It contains a 3D representation of a mechanical product or assembly. Previous versions of Adobe Acrobat allowed users to convert many 3D model file types to the PRC format, so the models could be embedded in .PDF files.

content: Adobe Systems developed the PRC file format to allow engineers, architects, and other CAD software users to more easily share 3D models with each other, as part of PDF-based documentation workflows. Each PRC file contains a product's structure, geometry, and product manufacturing information (PMI).

Adobe Acrobat Pro Extended 8 and 9 and Adobe Acrobat 3D allowed users to create PRC files and embed them in PDF files. Current versions of Acrobat do not allow users to create new PRC files, but they can still open, view, and embed previously-created PRC files.

instructions: You can open a PRC file and view the model it contains in Adobe Acrobat (multiplatform), Adobe Reader (multiplatform), and Foxit Reader (Windows). You can also use Adobe Acrobat to embed a PRC file in a PDF, to more easily share the file with other users.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
